intro: Oreocharis trichantha, commonly known as the hairy oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Oreocharis trichantha is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
